column4: Hi. Can Ubuntu with GUI run "OK" on an laptop: 500Mhz, 128Mb PC100 SDRAM, 5,6 HDD, 8Mb s3 agp2 GFX ??
xubuntu would be better - possible with the alternate CD installer on 128 MB with GNOME but not great
the desktop installer needs at least 192 MB
GNOME might be possible on 128 MB if you use the alternate CD to install
it will probably be pretty slow though
Do you think xubuntu will run fine on 128Mb?
yes - but again, use the alternate/ text installer CD
Is there any guide for tweaking xunbutu/ubuntu? Shut down animations and apps that loads and so on?
I think you'll find xubuntu takes care of that - it's quite lean
or you can install fluxbox ;-) ( I like fluxbox.. )
I have tried that, thats to hard to conf i think?
ah, well there are good docs linked from http://fluxbox.org - but try xubuntu first and see what you think
